intro: Androsace bryoides, commonly known as the mossy mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-like growth habit. The plant features small, rounded leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety layer of hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in umbels at the ends of the stems. Androsace bryoides thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
